description: Detects power-asymmetry patterns in which an actor demands empathy or lenience they consistently deny to others. Flags linguistic and behavioral inversions that reframe accountability as victimhood.

linguistic: projection language ('you made me', 'look what you did to me')
historical pattern denial ('not all men', 'I was joking', 'she provoked me')
behavioral: anger or retaliation when mirrored behavior is experienced
rapid role switching from aggressor to victim
use of guilt or pity to neutralize accountability

recommended_interventions: mirror accountability statements explicitly ('what would fairness look like reversed?')
pause escalation; invite mutual standard definition
re-contextualize blame framing back to behavior, not identity
